title: Fix #643: Add `ToXmlGenerator.Feature` or allowing XML Schema/JAXB compatible Infinity representation
body:
This PR adds a `ToXmlGenerator.Feature` to use XML Schema-compatible representation for floating-point infinity.

Fixes #643.

resolved_issues.title: XML serialization of floating-point infinity is incompatible with JAXB and XML Schema

fix_patch:
diff --git a/release-notes/CREDITS-2.x b/release-notes/CREDITS-2.x index 5ba8e773..6a3a9586 100644 --- a/release-notes/CREDITS-2.x +++ b/release-notes/CREDITS-2.x @@ -249,3 +249,9 @@ Arthur Chan (@arthurscchan) * Reported, contributed fix for #618: `ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException` thrown for invalid ending XML string when using JDK default Stax XML parser (2.17.0) + +Alex H (@ahcodedthat) + +* Contribtued #643: XML serialization of floating-point infinity is incompatible + with JAXB and XML Schema + (2.17.0) diff --git a/release-notes/VERSION-2.x b/release-notes/VERSION-2.x index d9cd9be2..a4ddecee 100644 --- a/release-notes/VERSION-2.x +++ b/release-notes/VERSION-2.x @@ -18,6 +18,9 @@ Project: jackson-dataformat-xml (FromXmlParser.Feature.AUTO_DETECT_XSI_TYPE) #637: `JacksonXmlAnnotationIntrospector.findNamespace()` should properly merge namespace information +#643: XML serialization of floating-point infinity is incompatible + with JAXB and XML Schema + (contributed by Alex H) * Upgrade Woodstox to 6.6.1 (latest at the time) 2.16.1 (24-Dec-2023) diff --git a/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/ser/ToXmlGenerator.java b/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/ser/ToXmlGenerator.java index 73c4e673..7721faeb 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/ser/ToXmlGenerator.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/ser/ToXmlGenerator.java @@ -106,6 +106,37 @@ public enum Feature implements FormatFeature * @since 2.17 */ AUTO_DETECT_XSI_TYPE(false), + + /** + * Feature that determines how floating-point infinity values are + * serialized. + *

+ * By default, {@link Float#POSITIVE_INFINITY} and + * {@link Double#POSITIVE_INFINITY} are serialized as {@code Infinity}, + * and {@link Float#NEGATIVE_INFINITY} and + * {@link Double#NEGATIVE_INFINITY} are serialized as + * {@code -Infinity}. This is the representation that Java normally + * uses for these values (see {@link Float#toString(float)} and + * {@link Double#toString(double)}), but JAXB and other XML + * Schema-conforming readers won't understand it. + *

+ * With this feature enabled, these values are instead serialized as + * {@code INF} and {@code -INF}, respectively. This is the + * representation that XML Schema and JAXB use (see the XML Schema + * primitive types + * float + * and + * double). + *

+ * When deserializing, Jackson always understands both representations, + * so there is no corresponding + * {@link com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat.xml.deser.FromXmlParser.Feature}. + *

+ * Feature is disabled by default for backwards compatibility. + * + * @since 2.17 + */ + WRITE_XML_SCHEMA_CONFORMING_FLOATS(false), ; final boolean _defaultState; @@ -1174,6 +1205,11 @@ public void writeNumber(long l) throws IOException @Override public void writeNumber(double d) throws IOException { + if (Double.isInfinite(d) && isEnabled(Feature.WRITE_XML_SCHEMA_CONFORMING_FLOATS)) { + writeNumber(d > 0d ? "INF" : "-INF"); + return; + } + _verifyValueWrite("write number"); if (_nextName == null) { handleMissingName(); @@ -1202,6 +1238,11 @@ public void writeNumber(double d) throws IOException @Override public void writeNumber(float f) throws IOException { + if (Float.isInfinite(f) && isEnabled(Feature.WRITE_XML_SCHEMA_CONFORMING_FLOATS)) { + writeNumber(f > 0f ? "INF" : "-INF"); + return; + } + _verifyValueWrite("write number"); if (_nextName == null) { handleMissingName();
hints:
Consider using the following identifiers for the new entities:
1. WRITE_XML_SCHEMA_CONFORMING_FLOATS: The WRITE_XML_SCHEMA_CONFORMING_FLOATS feature configures XML serialization to emit floating-point infinity values using XML Schema-compliant representations (INF/-INF), ensuring interoperability with XML readers that expect these formats.

title: Fix #637: merge namespace information properly

resolved_issues.title: `JacksonXmlAnnotationIntrospector.findNamespace()` should properly merge namespace information

title: Fix #578 (@JsonAppend properties serialized twice)

resolved_issues.title: `XmlMapper` serializes `@JsonAppend` property twice

title: Support unwrapping in `@JsonRawValue` serialization

resolved_issues.title: `@JacksonXmlText` does not work when paired with `@JsonRawValue`

title: Add mechanism for processing invalid XML names (transforming to valid ones)
body:
This commit introduces the `PROCESS_ESCAPED_MALFORMED_TAGS` and
`ESCAPE_MALFORMED_TAGS` features that control whether invalid
tag names will be escaped with an attribute.

fixes #523
fixes #524

resolved_issues.title: Dollars in POJO property names are not escaped on serialization

hints:
Consider using the following names for the new files:
1. src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/XmlTagProcessor.java
2. src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/dataformat/xml/XmlTagProcessors.java
Consider using the following identifiers for the new entities:
1. dataformat: The identifier 'dataformat' designates the custom XML data format extension implemented for handling XML serialization and deserialization, enabling configuration of tag name processing strategies to accommodate invalid XML characters in map keys and object fields.
2. java: The XmlTagProcessor interface defines methods for encoding and decoding XML tag names to handle invalid characters, enabling safe serialization and deserialization of objects with non-standard XML keys.
3. xml: The XmlTagProcessor interface enables custom encoding and decoding of XML tag names to escape or handle invalid characters during serialization and deserialization processes.
4. XmlTagProcessors: XmlTagProcessors provides a set of custom XML tag processor implementations that can be selected to control how XML tag names are encoded and decoded, enabling safe handling of tag names with invalid or special characters in the XML data format.
5. newReplacementProcessor: The newReplacementProcessor function generates an XmlTagProcessor instance that replaces invalid characters in XML tag names with an underscore or custom replacement string, ensuring generated XML is well-formed when serializing and deserializing data.
6. newPassthroughProcessor: The 'newPassthroughProcessor' method provides a default XmlTagProcessor instance that passes XML tag names through unchanged, and should be used wherever the default, non-transforming tag name handling is desired for XML serialization or parsing.
7. util: The identifier 'util' should refer to a custom XML tag processor utility implemented to facilitate conversion or escaping of XML tag names, and should be used for setting or handling XML tag processing behavior throughout serialization and deserialization workflows.
8. newAlwaysOnBase64Processor: The identifier `newAlwaysOnBase64Processor` designates a static factory method that provides an XML tag processor which always encodes and decodes tag names using base64, ensuring safe and reversible handling of arbitrary map keys and field names in XML serialization and deserialization.
9. newBase64Processor: The identifier newBase64Processor provides a factory method to create an XML tag processor that encodes and decodes tag names with invalid characters using base64 encoding, ensuring safe serialization and deserialization of map keys or property names in XML.
10. xmlTagProcessor: The xmlTagProcessor is a configurable component that processes XML tag names during serialization and deserialization, allowing customization of XML name handling strategies in XmlMapper and related factory classes.
